intro: Centaurea goerkii, commonly known as the Afghan gladiola, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of smaller flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its striking purple or blue flowers bloom in summer, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. Centaurea goerkii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
